{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3501646,"name":"Gijs van Maanen","username":"gijsvm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gijsvm/{size}/240821_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T12:53:32.801Z","cooked":"

Hey, my team and I finished our drivetrain and tuned the PID, then we started creating autonomous paths in pathplanner. paths with a constant heading work fine but we experience a problem when changing the heading and simultaniously driving, I tried to find the reason of this by checking all constants but all seem to be correct, our code is at: GitHub - GhostFoundation/Buildingseason2025: Ghost foundation Buildingseason repo of 2025 did anyone else experience similar problems and do you know how to fix this? thanks alot, team 7333 Ghost

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T13:09:26.106Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":149,"readers_count":148,"score":94.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":485128,"topic_slug":"problems-with-autonomous-paths","display_username":"Gijs van Maanen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/GhostFoundation/Buildingseason2025","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - GhostFoundation/Buildingseason2025: Ghost foundation Buildingseason repo of 2025","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69999,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/problems-with-autonomous-paths/485128/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3501651,"name":"Aiden Keegan","username":"AidenK","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aidenk/{size}/209786_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T13:11:29.125Z","cooked":"

It looks like you set the max speed of the module to the max speed of the drivetrain.

SwerveDriveKinematics.desaturateWheelSpeeds(
        swerveModuleStates, DriveConstants.kMaxSpeedMetersPerSecond);

In reality, the max module speed should be higher than the max chassis speed. In the image below, I drew out the path an individual swerve module takes when the chassis is going straight and when it is rotating. Note that even though the chassis is travelling the same distance, the module has to go further, and thus the module must be able to go faster than the chassis if it is rotating.

Straight1080×1350 47 KB

I would try increasing the max module speed to be closer to its true value, and hopefully your paths should start working

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-04T13:11:29.125Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":48.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":485128,"topic_slug":"problems-with-autonomous-paths","display_username":"Aiden Keegan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61725,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"+1, -1"},"post_url":"/t/problems-with-autonomous-paths/485128/2","custom_user_title":"+1, -1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3501715,"name":"Gijs van Maanen","username":"gijsvm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gijsvm/{size}/240821_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-04T14:20:08.701Z","cooked":"

I changed the kMaxSpeedMetersPerSecond from 3 to 5.66, this is the max module speed according to REV, but still the path isnt executed properly, what could the problem be then?

Did you create two separate constants? You should have one for the drivetrain (slower) and one for the module (faster)

And how would i use them both, should i keep the maxswervespeed at 3 and a maxmodule speed at 5.66 and only change

SwerveDriveKinematics.desaturateWheelSpeeds(
        swerveModuleStates, DriveConstants.kMaxSpeedMetersPerSecond);

to

SwerveDriveKinematics.desaturateWheelSpeeds(
        swerveModuleStates, DriveConstants.kMaxModuleSpeed);

?

i uploaded the code with the max module speed but it still doesnt work, eg. i have a path like this:

which turns 180 degrees while moving about 3m, in reality it does something like this:

The code is also on github if you want to check that, thank you for helping us

If its not that then im honestly not sure, it almost looks like its trying to drive field relative when its being set to robot relative, but I cant find anything wrong in the code.

the only thing that we do differently is instead of

 (speeds, feedforwards) -> driveRobotRelative(speeds)

we do

this::runVelocity

Our codes here if you want to take a look
